After Anchorage summit, Europeans stand firmly behind Zelensky in the face of Trump
subhead: Several leaders from across Europe are set to travel to Washington on Monday with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to meet with the American president. The Ukrainian crisis now pits Kyiv and the main European governments against Moscow and Washington.

title: Israelis rally nationwide calling for end to Gaza war, hostage deal

byline: By Assma Maad and Adel Miliani

title: Bolivia's divided left risks losing elections after 20 years of dominance
subhead: On August 17, Bolivians will vote in the first round of presidential and parliamentary elections. The left appears set to pay the price for the economic crisis and internal infighting, as former president Evo Morales has been barred from running.
byline: By Amanda Chaparro (Patamanta and Batallas (La Paz Department), special correspondent)

title: India and Pakistan, like Israel and Palestine, remain locked in their founding disputes
subhead: While it is important not to conflate the two, certain similarities are evident in the trajectory of these two seemingly interminable crises, historian Jean-Pierre Filiu writes in his column.

title: Chinese Hollywood races to cash in on the minidramas boom
subhead: The Hengdian studios are taking advantage of the surge in super short productions, with episodes lasting only a few minutes and designed specifically for viewing on smartphones.

title: Dmytro Kuleba, former Ukrainian foreign minister: 'Putin stands to gain more from a ceasefire than we do'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, the former Ukrainian foreign minister under President Volodymyr Zelensky analyzes the outcome of the meeting between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin on Friday in Alaska and discusses the next steps.
byline: Interview by Thomas d’Istria (Kyiv, correspondent) and Emmanuel Grynszpan (Kyiv, special correspondent)

China's robotics industry surges amid promise of a $5 trillion market
subhead: From a global conference to robotic games inside the National Stadium, Beijing becomes the world capital of robots from August 8 to 17. The event showcases China's extraordinary acceleration in this sector – from automated industrial arms to AI-powered humanoids.
byline: By Vincent Fagot and Jordan Pouille (Beijing (China), correspondent)

title: Haitham Karajay, chef: 'My mother cooked every day. I was lucky to have her by my side until she died'
subhead: 'Refugee Recipes' (6/6). Chef Haitham Karajay sought refuge in France to escape from the Syrian civil war. He quickly turned to cooking, with the support of the NGO Refugee Food, for which he now works.

title: In Angers, working-class restaurants are slowly disappearing
subhead: Since the Covid-19 pandemic, about 10 establishments that offered full meals at affordable prices have closed across the western French city. Inflation, meal vouchers now usable in supermarkets and the changing lifestyles of young workers have taken their toll on these eateries.
